page.title: 09SHOPPING SURVEY, WOOTTON
page.content: Most shops in Wootton are food stores which cater for the local communities' everyday needs. There are also a few other shops which sell clothes and provide services for the local community such as hairdressers, chemists, DIY stores, electrical repair and a launderette. There are a total of 21 shops in Wootton High Street. The variety of goods sold is small and groceries in particular are quite expensive, a common feature in a small village. There is also a small market called Bumbles which sells a great variety of second-hand goods including washing machines! There is a doctor and a veterinary surgery in the market. One problem shoppers face is the lack of parking facilities near the shops. The main road is very busy which makes it hard for pedestrians to cross.
